entry.title: WebNN: Remove MLAutoPad
entry.content: WebNN spec removes MLAutoPad support: https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/pull/587. Chromium implementation should align with that.

entry.title: "Always open these types of links in the associated app" doesn't work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a website in incognito mode that will want to redirect to another website 2. Click the "Always allow ... to open links of this type" checkbox 3. Open the same website again - the checkbox popup will appear again
# Problem Description I run UI tests on a browser in incognito mode. The tests want to use a tool called "Soneta.helper". Every time I start the browser, the "Open Soneta.helper?" popup appears. I click the "Always allow ... to open links of this type" checkbox and these settings are not remembered. The next time I launch the browser, the popup appears again.
We tried adding URLAllowlist to the registry but it doesn't work either.
How can we solve the problem described above? Thank you in advance for your answer.
# Summary "Always open these types of links in the associated app" doesn't work
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Allow changing Headless' screen properties
entry.content:
Chrome's headless mode can be used to save resources while automating the browser for various purposes, among which is the testing of websites.
Right now, headless doesn't support any way to change screen properties like scale or color depth, so it is harder to test the effect of different values for these properties on our webpage. However, the code does have the ability to set custom parameters for these properties, all we need is to expose them for usage.

entry.title: PartitionAlloc Memroy increase consecutively from 100M+ to 2500M+ when play mse/hls video
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. visit netrange AfroLandTV csp, https://ver.netrange.com/internal.mse-player/production/v1/82/index.html?stream=https%3A%2F%2Fapi-ott.afrolandtv.com%2Floggingmediaurlpassthrough%2Fa.m3u8%3Fversion%3D12%26id%3D816%26partner%3Dnetrange&epg=https%3A%2F%2Fapi-ott.afrolandtv.com%2Fgetrawvideosegments%3Fversion%3D12.5%26rss_format%3Dxmltv%26linear_channel_id%3D815%26partner%3Dnetrange%2 6days%3D2&csp=OTTera#/ 2. click play button, it will play live streaming video (hls) automatic
# Problem Description 1. we find that the page memory of renderer process is increase consecutively, from 100M+ to 2500M+, according to chrome more/task manager panel 2. and we find that PartitionAlloc Memroy increase consecutively frome 100M+ to 2500M+, and it caused the page memory of renderer process increase , accroding to chromium memory-infra tool https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/memory-infra/
# Additional Comments 1. The problem is different from my another reported bugs(https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40282286) 2. Does is the page problem itself with hls, acconding to https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/issues/5402 or there are some memory leak in blink when play mse/hls video？
# Summary PartitionAlloc Memroy increase consecutively from 100M+ to 2500M+ when play mse/hls video
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: FCM is going to remove some endpoints this year.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Sorry that this might not be a bug.
# Problem Description FCM is going to remove some endpoints this year. The link below describes the update of FCM endpoint. https://firebase.google.com/docs/cloud-messaging/migrate-v1
Currently, Chrome uses FCM as a Push Service for VAPID Web Push and the endpoint that the Push Manager returned to us is the deprecated endpoint. I would like to know if Chrome team noticed this issue or not because it will affect production usage when FCM team remove the endpoints from their service. I confirmed with FCM team and they referred me to here for further confirmation.
# Summary FCM is going to remove some endpoints this year.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>PushAPI
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem

entry.title: Deprecate allow_submit_with_open_deps
entry.content:
`allow_submit_open_deps` allows users to trigger a full-run with open deps. However, this option no longer makes sense since go/chained-cq-votes have been introduced. That is, if a given dependent CL has open deps, which are unsubmitted ancestor CLs in a relation chain, chained-cq-votes will copy CQ+2 into each of the open deps, and then submit them in order.
Therefore, `allow_submit_open_deps` is noop. Please update documents and mark it as deprecated to indicate that the option is noop.
Note `allow_submit_open_deps` is allowed only if the CQ config is not set with combine_cl. https://source.chromium.org/chromium/infra/infra/+/main:go/src/go.chromium.org/luci/cv/internal/configs/validation/project.go;l=207

entry.title: (Windows) DComp pending frames improvements
entry.content:
DCompPresenter (like DirectCompositionChildSurfaceWin before it) uses D3D11 event queries to track GPU work for each frame. These queries are polled on the GPU main thread at vblank time (posted from VSyncThreadWin) and used to send PresentationFeedback back to Viz.
It might be better to instead use EnqueueSetEvent and either 1) poll the event handles on the vsync thread which can be done since there's no involvement of the D3D11 immediate context, or 2) use WaitableEventWatcher or similar to issue a callback when the event signals. The latter would be a larger change in behavior from the current implementation so I'm inclined to go with the first option.
